phrases: is to break new ground without fear of failure!
What are you tryin' to do?
If Naru hears, it will not be a surprise!
We thought we would all throw a party for her.
You are an adult, so contribute a thousand yen.
Party fees for a kid's birthday party?!
We cannot buy a whole one with our pocket change.
Hiro-nii will bring the food this evening.
Sensei, you get a present for her, too.
Wait, I have to write today...
I guess that is enough for today.
It is perfect for wrapping around my waist!
I kind of need a favor...
This is the only present I can think of.
Could I have a rhinoceros beetle?
I will pay you ten yen!
That is a lot for a kid, right?!
I am givin' her rhinoceros beetles!
Just one will not hurt, right?
I am going to give her a hundred of'them to make an insect bed!
That is more like a punishment.
Besides, I do not want to give the same present as someone else!
What are you giving her, Ichiro and Jiro?
Do not make up names for us!
You have all thought on it.
You oughta think hard on it, too, Sensei!
I will give her a stag beetle!
If you can catch that many rhinoceros beetles,
then a stag beetle should be even easier, right?
Bug catchin' are not as easy as ya think, Sensei.
Heck, life are not that easy.
but they are tough to find.
That is because you are children, is not it?
I can see higher up, so it will be easy!
The battle are not over'til the beetle's caught!
If ya cannot catch even one rhinoceros beetle,
Naru's going to be fed up with ya!
I do not exactly care, but I am still irritated.
Kenta, there is one over here!
I are not going to lose!
That is a drone beetle, doofus!
I will not lose to you!
It is a bit high up.
Sensei, you did not leave yet?
Do not you mean, Thank you?
I cannot leave without catching one.
I can catch any bug, no matter how high up.
Can you lend me the net real quick?
You came bug catchin' when you will not even touch'them?!
It might bite me, or it could carry some weird disease!
They do not bite, and do not carry diseases!
Up close, it is even more gross than I imagined!
It is just like a cockroach!
They are not the same at all, stupid!
Anyway, give me the net, now!
I think it might have bit me!
Could a guy like this catch bugs?
Someone must have been keepin' it, but it got away!
It would not be here otherwise!
Why, is it really that amazing?
We will join forces to catch it!
Naru'll be thrilled to get such big game!
An' we will let Naru know how good you did!
We will give her the big game together!
How can ya fall twice in one day?
Yer clumsiness is a talent in itself.
I am never trusting you guys again.
I knew I could not let it get away,
so I held on tight to the net.
I cannot believe you smashed the Hercules!
You would say that because of some bug?
But we were going to give it to Naru!
I will give ya one I caught.
'Cuz you worked hard for Naru's sake.
I never met an adult who would play seriously like you, Sensei.
I am going to have gobs of fun this summer!
Now I am one step closer to your level!
I never had any intention of playing with you guys.
I will be going at it seriously from now on, so be ready!
is set up for the party?
How did you guys get into my house?!
How many years do ya think we have used this as our base?
so you can have this back.
I went to the hardware store for a duplicate bike key, and it was surprisingly cheap!
Wait, if there are five of them...
Maybe while playin' in the hills out back?
Sensei, do you have a present ready?
I picked up some peacock feathers.
You guys really know what makes Naru tick.
This is my first time throwing a birthday party.
We could not have done it without you, Sensei.
Let us do this every year from now on!
Shoot off the cracker when she comes in.
Uh, no, I will give mine later!
Ticket to do anything you say
A grade schooler's Mother's Day present?!
Naru, it is okay to be mad!
Ticket to do anything you say One time
I am frightened by how thrilled you sound...
I keep watering these sunflowers, even though I have no idea who planted them or when.
If I left them alone, they would probably grow up fine on their own...
Grampa's going on a grave visit.
He said to bring you along, Sensei.
Are you sure you want an outsider like me at your family grave?
I hafta go to the fields,
so I was thinkin' I would have you keep vigil over the gravesite flame.
That is got to be bad omen!
Well, take care of the rest!
Naru knows the ropes, so just do as she says!
He just dumped it on me...
I have never made a proper grave visit before.
I do not know who is resting here,
but I hope you will treat me well today.
Sensei, first ya got to set the lan'ern.
Now that you mention it, all the graves have one.
Until this flame goes out, we must not leave the grave.
These are candles that burn for two hours.
We need to stay here for that long?
I got these in case we get bored!
Mind if I pay a visit, too?
I came to offer an incense stick.
I was friends with Naru's gramma, y'know.
Somehow or other, I managed to live through this past year.
Sensei, ya must have it rough in this heat.
With an outsider like me here,
Naru's grandma probably cannot rest easy.
See how the flame's dancin' up and down?
That means her gramma's smilin' down on ya.
Guess I will do my best, if it will make the master of this grave happy.
Hey, they are coming this way!
Running wild without regard for anyone she is disturbing!
Man, it is hard to run in a yukata.
I want to do it, too!
Sorry, those were the last fallin' umbrellas.
C'mon, Sensei, give us some reaction!
He is telling us to help?
Fine, we will help, we will help!
Stop giving us the evil eye!
So this is different from Obon in Tokyo?
For starters, we do not visit in the evening,
and we do not offer uncooked rice.
We also do not set off fireworks, or wear yukata, or hang paper lanterns.
The gold gravestone lettering is strange, too!
They are not gold everywhere in Japan?!
Well, since I rarely make grave visits,
I cannot exactly talk like I am an expert on the customs.
Well, we only come to visit graves during Obon, too.
And we really only come to set off fireworks.
Oh, and to see the onde.
D'ya mind if we proceed past your gravesite?
They dance at each family grave that is had a death since last Obon.
What does that mean, translated into Japanese?
It are not exactly a foreign language.
Also, is not he looking my way?
You should see the look on your face!
You are in the troop, too?!
They were shorthanded, so I am filling in.
We have to hurry to the next one!
I still have dancing to do.
I want to watch you dance.
Sensei's gradually starting to fit in here.
He is totally actin' as Naru's guardian.
I have tried to avoid thinking about it much,
but did not Sensei come here because he punched someone eminent in calligraphy?
What if his punishment were lifted?
Naru's gramma took good care of us while she was alive.
Why did you leave our gravesite alone to goof off here?!
Sensei, tell him ya made me come here!
How did you know I was here?
Mom told me to take incense to Naru's grandma.
May I offer some this year, too?
Each year, people take turns paying her a visit.
until now, Naru's had to keep vigil over the flame by herself.
Come to think of it, I have never seen Naru's parents...
Today's been more fun than usual!
Give me a break, you brat.
It was always boring waiting for grampa to get back,
but today I do not want to leave.
It must be'cuz you are here, Sensei.
I never realized it since she is always with someone...
But she gets lonely just like anyone else.
If I left her alone, she would probably grow up fine on her own...
But maybe I will look after her when I have time.
It is already time to leave?
Your grandpa has not come back yet.
I am going to keep playin' here!
Did you come here to fish for dinner?
You are looking like one of the locals, fishing at the lake like this.
The villagers seem to like you too, Sensei.
I am afraid I cannot do that.
Well, when there is a place that accepts you as you are,
do not you feel like it is safe to attempt the impossible?
Treat me to lobster once you are a big-shot calligrapher!
Do not tell the shopkeeper, okay?
That is what he said in my dream.
It was just a dream, but it still made me happy.
